title: U.S. Government Acquires 10% Stake in Intel Amid CEO Resignation Demand
snippets: The president's highly unusual announcement underscores the Trump administration's desire to take control over U.S. businesses.
The extraordinary development follows a meeting between CEO Lip-Bu Tan and Trump after he called for Tan's removal.
Trump: Intel agreed to sell 10% stake to U.S. government
Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that the U.S. government has taken a 10% stake in chipmaker Intel.
The US investment in Intel is a rare example of the government taking a stake in a private company. INTC closed up on Friday but dipped after hours.

The US is investing $8.9 billion into Intel, but most of the funds come from money that the government was supposed to pay the embattled chipmaker anyway. In an announcement on Friday, Intel said the federal government will fund its investment using the remaining $5.7 billion in grants it hasn’t yet

Intel has agreed to the U.S. government taking a stake in it, President Donald Trump and the company announced Friday, capping an extraordinary chapter between the White House and the computer-chip maker.
Such federal government ownership of a major corporation would mark a dramatic departure from long-standing U.S. policy.
Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick previously said the U.S. government should receive equity in return for the CHIPS Act cash grants Intel has received.
titles: Intel will give the U.S. government a 10% stake, Trump says
Trump says US to take 10 percent stake in Intel
Trump: Intel agreed to sell 10% stake to U.S. government - Axios
U.S. government takes 10% stake in Intel, as Trump expands control over private sector
It's official: The US government is taking a nearly 10% stake in Intel
US government takes 10 percent stake in Intel in exchange for money it was already on the hook for
Intel agrees to 10% U.S. government stake. It may not be the last chip company to do so.
US government plans to take a 10% stake in Intel
Trump says Intel agreed to give the government 10% of the chipmaker. ‘We do a lot of deals like that. I’ll do more of them’
summary: The U.S. government has taken an unprecedented 10% stake in chipmaker Intel, a move announced by President Trump and confirmed by both parties. This decision follows Trump's demand for Intel CEO Lip-Bu Tan to resign due to his connections with Chinese firms. The investment, totaling $8.9 billion, is part of a broader strategy to support the struggling chipmaker and is financed largely through previously allocated government grants. This development marks a significant shift in U.S. policy, as it is rare for the government to take ownership in private corporations. The deal was finalized after

title: Lyle Menendez Denied Parole in First Hearing After 1989 Parents' Murder
snippets: The hearing stretched for more than 10 hours and examined his violations in prison and the 1989 killings of his parents in their Beverly Hills mansion.
The Menendez brothers were convicted and jailed in the 1989 for murdering their parents in Los Angeles.
Lyle Menendez was denied parole during his first-ever parole hearing on Friday.

Parole board rules against elder Menendez brother, convicted over killing parents in Los Angeles in 1989

Lyle Menendez was denied parole for his role in the 1989 killings of his parents on Friday, just a day after the California parole board
A day after denying release for his younger brother, Erik, a California Parole Board ruled that Lyle Menendez should also remain in prison for gunning down his parents with a shotgun in 1989.
titles: Lyle Menendez joins brother in being denied parole in parents' LA murder
Lyle Menendez denied parole a day after brother Erik
Lyle Menendez also denied parole, will stay in prison with Erik Menendez
Lyle Menendez denied parole a day after brother Erik’s bid rejected
Lyle Menendez denied parole, will remain in prison along with younger brother Erik
summary: Lyle Menendez was denied parole at his first-ever hearing on Friday, following a decision a day prior against his brother, Erik. Both were convicted for the 1989 murder of their parents in their Beverly Hills mansion. The parole board's decision comes after examining Lyle's prison violations and the details of the case during a hearing that lasted over 10 hours.

title: Canada Exempts Most U.S. Goods from Tariffs, Keeps 25% on Key Metals, Autos
snippets: Prime Minister Mark Carney says most Canadian goods will be exempted from US tariffs while some sectoral duties remain.
Canada announced Friday it was dropping many of its retaliatory tariffs on U.S. goods, though the 25% counter-tariff on autos, steel and aluminum remains.
Prime Minister Mark Carney announces removal of 25% levy on many goods from neighbour
Prime Minister Mark Carney said Canada will lift its tariffs on U.S. goods that comply with a free trade pact but keep tariffs on U.S. steel, aluminum and autos.
Canada’s leader said he would follow the United States in dropping tariffs against American goods covered by the existing free trade agreement.
titles: Canada to ease most retaliatory tariffs against United States
Canada drops many of its retaliatory tariffs on the U.S.
Canada to drop retaliatory tariffs on billions of dollars’ worth of US products
Canada drops some retaliatory tariffs in bid to restart trade talks
Canada To Drop Some Retaliatory Tariffs on U.S. Products, Carney Says
summary: Canada, under Prime Minister Mark Carney, will exempt most U.S. goods from tariffs, aligning with the Canada-United States-Mexico Agreement. However, Canada will maintain a 25% tariff on U.S. steel, aluminum, and autos. This decision follows Canada's move to drop many retaliatory tariffs on U.S. products, while the U.S. grants tariff exemptions for Canadian goods covered by the trade pact.

title: Man Wrongly Deported to El Salvador Returns to U.S. for Trial
snippets: The case of Abrego Garcia, a Maryland man originally from El Salvador, raised basic questions of due process in Trump's crackdown on undocumented immigrants after he was arrested and sent to a maximum security prison in El Salvador, violating a U.S. immigration judge's 2019 order prohibiting his dep
Abrego Garcia will return to family as he awaits trial over alleged human smuggling brought by Trump administration.
The Salvadoran native has been in criminal custody since the federal government brought him back to the U.S. in June to face human smuggling charges.
Abrego Garcia was mistakenly deported in March to El Salvador, triggering a months-long legal battle between his lawyers and the federal government.
titles: Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from federal custody pending criminal trial
Wrongfully deported Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from Tennessee jail
WATCH:  Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from criminal custody in Tennessee
Kilmar Abrego Garcia Released From Criminal Custody As DHS Reportedly Threatens Deportation
summary: Kilmar Abrego Garcia, originally from El Salvador and living in Maryland, was mistakenly deported to El Salvador in March, despite a U.S. immigration judge's 2019 order against his deportation. After a legal battle, he was brought back to the U.S. in June to face charges of human smuggling, a case brought by the Trump administration. Garcia was released from criminal custody in Tennessee on Friday and will return to his family in Maryland as he awaits trial.

This development clears him from the probe into irregular prop bet activities and potentially revitalizes his opportunities in free agency.

title: Tour Bus Crash in New York Kills 5, Injures Over 40
snippets: Passengers from China, India, Philippines, the Middle East and US were on board the bus when it crashed at full speed.
The bus rolled over while returning from Niagara Falls. Many of the passengers were Indian, Chinese and Filipino, with police saying some were thrown from the bus.

More than 40 passengers evaluated or treated at hospitals with injuries ranging from head trauma to broken arms and legs

At least five people, including a child, were killed after a tour bus carrying 51 people crashed in upstate New Yor
titles: Foreign nationals among 5 killed in New York state tour bus crash
US: 5 killed after New York-bound tourist bus crash
Five people killed, including one child, in New York bus crash
summary: A tour bus carrying 51 passengers from China, India, the Philippines, the Middle East, and the US crashed in upstate New York while returning from Niagara Falls, resulting in at least five fatalities, including a child. Over 40 passengers were evaluated or treated for injuries varying from head trauma to broken limbs. The bus rolled over at full speed, with some passengers being ejected during the incident.

title: Commanders Trade Brian Robinson Jr. to 49ers for 2026 Sixth-Round Pick

Christian McCaffrey has a new handcuff to draft and stash

This move was reported by ESPN's Adam Schefter. Robinson, who was selected in the third round of the 2022 Draft, will now serve as a backup option for the 49ers, complementing their current running back lineup.

snippets: South Korean acknowledges that its soldiers fired warning shots after North Korean troops briefly crossed the border.
Pyongyang has accused Seoul forces of provocation after troops fired during a tense incident along the demarcation line. The claim coincides with joint South Korean-US military drills.

Seoul says military fired warning shots on Tuesday after troops from the North briefly crossed border

South Korea fired warning shots at North Korean soldiers who briefly crossed the heavily fortified border earlier this week, Seoul said on Saturday, after Pyongyang accused it of a “deliber
titles: North Korea accuses South Korean troops of firing warning shots near border
North Korea protests warning shots at border with South
North Korea accuses South Korea of ‘deliberate provocation’ after warning shots fired at soldiers on border
summary: South Korean soldiers fired warning shots at North Korean troops who briefly crossed the heavily fortified border, Seoul confirmed. This incident occurred during a period of joint South Korean-US military drills, leading Pyongyang to accuse Seoul of provocation. The confrontation underscores the ongoing tension along the demarcation line separating the two Koreas.

Following his announcement, stocks for furniture and home goods companies such as Wayfair, RH, and Williams-Sonoma experienced a decline after the market closed. This move by Trump suggests upcoming industry-specific levies that could impact the furniture sector.

title: Edmonton Elks Beat Ottawa Redblacks 30-20 for Third Straight Win
snippets: The Edmonton Elks rolled to their third straight win, taking advantage of yet another sluggish start by the Ottawa Redblacks, to leave the nation’s capital with a 30-20 victory Friday night. With Ottawa (3-8) mounting a comeback, Edmonton quarterback Cody Fajardo, who finished 22-for-28 for 270 yard
The Edmonton Elks rolled to their third straight win, taking advantage of yet another sluggish start by the Ottawa Redblacks, to leave the nation’s capital with a 30-20 victory Friday night.
titles: Visiting Elks win third straight with 30-20 victory over Redblacks
Visiting Elks defeat Redblacks to earn third straight with
summary: The Edmonton Elks secured their third consecutive win with a 30-20 victory over the Ottawa Redblacks. Despite a late comeback attempt by Ottawa, Edmonton's quarterback Cody Fajardo led his team to victory, completing 22 of 28 passes for 270 yards. This match highlighted Ottawa's sluggish start, contributing to their 3-8 record.

summary: Stocks surged following Federal Reserve Chair Powell's signal of impending interest rate cuts. Powell, despite being urged by Trump to resign, discussed the economic risks posed by tariffs and other challenges. The Federal Reserve is preparing to lower interest rates to address these issues.

title: UN Declares Famine in Northern Gaza Amid Ongoing Conflict
snippets: A UN-backed body confirms famine in Gaza City and surrounding areas, and says half a million are facing "catastrophic" conditions.
More than half a million people in and around Gaza City are facing catastrophic conditions “characterized by starvation, destitution and death,” the IPC said.
At least half a million people in the enclave were facing the most severe conditions measured by U.N.-backed international experts: starvation, acute malnutrition and death.
titles: Famine in Gaza City is 'failure of humanity', UN chief says
Famine confirmed in Gaza City region, global hunger monitor says
Gaza City and Surrounding Areas Officially Hit by Famine, Global Group Says
summary: The U.N.-backed Integrated Food Security Phase Classification (IPC) has officially declared a famine in northern Gaza, marking the first confirmation of famine in the Middle East. This crisis comes after 22 months of conflict between Israel and the Palestinian territory. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres described the situation as a 'man-made disaster' and called for immediate action. The IPC reports that over half a million people in and around Gaza City are experiencing catastrophic conditions, including starvation, destitution, and death.

title: Pirates' Bubba Chandler Shines in MLB Debut with Four Scoreless Innings

Bubba Chandler didn’t disappoint in his major league debut for the Pittsburgh Pirates.

Top pitching prospect Bubba Chandler shines in Pirates debut vs. Rockies
summary: Pirates rookie Bubba Chandler, a highly regarded pitching prospect, made an impressive major league debut by pitching four scoreless innings and securing a save. Chandler's performance for the Pittsburgh Pirates was notable, marking a successful start to his career in the MLB.

Trump's demand intensifies his administration's pressure on Cook.

title: 2026 World Cup Draw Set for Dec 5 at Kennedy Center, Shifts from Vegas
snippets: The 2026 World Cup draw will be held at the Kennedy Center, and not in Las Vegas. It opened up questions about more political football between Trump and Infantino.

This decision marks a location change from the previously speculated venue in Las Vegas, sparking discussions on potential political implications involving Trump and FIFA President Gianni Infantino.

title: Bluesky Blocks Mississippi Access Over New Age Verification Law
snippets: Bluesky will block access from Mississippi IP addresses in response to a new state law requiring age verification and parental consent for underage users. The decision, outlined in a blog post, will stand until courts decide the fate of the law. “Mississippi’s approach would fundamentally chan

In a blog post published on Friday, the company explains that, as a small team, it doesn't have the resources to make the substantial technical changes this type of law would require, and it raised concerns about the law's broad scope and privacy implications.
titles: Bluesky blocks Mississippi under new age verification law
Bluesky blocks service in Mississippi over age assurance law
summary: Bluesky announced it will block access from Mississippi due to a new law requiring age verification and parental consent for underage users. The company, citing limited resources and concerns over privacy and the law's broad scope, stated the block will remain until the law's fate is decided by courts. This decision was shared in a blog post, highlighting the challenges small teams face in adapting to such legal requirements.

title: Study: Oil and Gas Pollution Causes 91,000 US Deaths Annually, Minorities Most A
snippets:
Study analyzed health impacts of fossil fuels from exploration to end use, and found communities of color bear brunt of harm

Air pollution from oil and gas causes more than 90,000 premature deaths and sickens hundreds of th

Air pollution from oil and gas is causing 91,000 premature deaths and hundreds of thousands of health issues across the United States annually, with Black, Asian, Native American and Hispanic groups consistently the most affected, finds a major new study led by researchers at UCL and the Stockholm E
titles: Air pollution from oil and gas causes 90,000 premature US deaths each year, says new study
Oil and gas air pollution linked to 91,000 early deaths in the US each year
summary: A study by UCL and the Stockholm Environment Institute found that air pollution from oil and gas results in 91,000 premature deaths annually in the US, disproportionately affecting communities of color. States like California, Texas, New York, Pennsylvania, and New Jersey are the most impacted. The research highlights the significant health burdens borne by Black, Asian, Native American, and Hispanic populations due to fossil fuel pollution.

title: Developer Convicted for Planting "Kill Switch" in Servers
snippets: The ex-developer was convicted of planting malicious code designed to crash its servers in the event that he was fired.
Disgruntled developer was caught after naming the "kill switch" after himself.
titles: Developer gets prison time for sabotaging former employer’s network with a ‘kill switch’
Developer gets 4 years for activating network “kill switch” to avenge his firing
summary: A former developer was found guilty of inserting harmful code into servers to crash them if he was terminated. The disgruntled employee was identified when the "kill switch" was traced back to him. The outcome is that the developer has been convicted for the malicious act.
